preqs: 12 credit points at first year level in Art history and theory, or Theory of Art and Design, Visual Culture or permission from Unit Coordinator.

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with (I/W) {AHT3440, CLS2440, CLS3440, TAD3440, VSA2440, VSA3440}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {AHT%, CLS%, TAD%, VSA%}
Incompatible with (I/W) {AHT3440, CLS2440, CLS3440, TAD3440, VSA2440, VSA3440}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {AHT%, CLS%, TAD%, VSA%}

description: This unit will offer a history of photography from its invention in the mid-nineteenth century through to the present. It will also offer a survey of the various attempts to theorise the new medium of photography. The unit will conclude with a detailed consideration of the new "digital" era we are now living in, in which not only is "photography" the dominant artistic medium and technique but the whole world becomes in effect "photographic". Today it is arguable that "photography' in the form of the digital not only determines the making of images but also their circulation and reception.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
